hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime BTC Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and its 10-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day average while price consolidates within a 5% range for 7+ days, a breakout above the consolidation high on >1.5x average volume will initiate a momentum move toward the nearest major resistance level (previous local high).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often represent equilibrium before directional moves. Low volatility during consolidation indicates declining selling pressure. A high-volume breakout suggests institutional or large trader accumulation, providing momentum for a move to test nearby resistance.
entry_conditions: BTC price range (high-low) < 5% over last 7 days
BTC closes above consolidation high on volume > 1.5x 20-day average
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain (closes back inside range within 48 hours) or price reverses to break consolidation low before reaching target.
